WARNING: This file is NOT where your settings are stored.
This file is only used to display the settings in the game.
The file you are looking for is 'settings.txt' in your saves folder.
If you want to change your settings, edit that file instead.

disasters: This may result in up to 1/3rd of your Pack dying in one moon.
showxp: Show exact XP and nutrition status
Will turn 'experience: proficient' into 'experience: proficient (151)'; and 'nutrition: full' into 'nutrition: full (70)'.
random med cat: Allow medicine wolves to be randomly selected on patrol
Medicine wolves can be selected with the patrol buttons +1, +3, +6
fading: Allow dead wolves to fade away
After 202 moons, dead wolves will be unloaded, and saved separately. No family relations will be lost.
save_faded_copy: Save a complete copy of faded wolves information
A complete copy of faded wolf save info will be saved in plain-text.
backgrounds: Even with this off, the camp you choose will still affect the events you encounter.
moons and seasons: Displays Pack age and current Pack season on several pages

deputy: Allow leaders to automatically choose a new deputy
The Warrior Code rules will be taken into account when choosing a deputy.
12_moon_graduation: All apprentices will graduate at 12 moons.
retirement: Wolves will never retire due to a permanent condition
When this setting is off, wolves with permanent conditions will choose whether or not they want to retire.
become_mediator: Allow warriors and elders to choose to become mediators
Warriors and elders will have a chance to become mediators upon timeskip.

affair: Allow wolves to breed with wolves that aren't their mates
This will allow mated and unmated wolves to have pups with other wolves they are not mated with. This includes, but is not limited to, affairs/cheating.
same sex birth: Allow all wolves to get pregnant despite their gender and all couples to birth puppies despite same-sex status.
same sex adoption: If same-sex birth is disabled, this option greatly increases the chances of same-sex couples adopting.
single parentage: Allow wolves to have puppies with an unknown second parent
Allow wolves to have puppies with an unknown second biological parent. The wolf will be listed as the only biological parent.
romantic with former mentor: Allow romantic interactions with former mentors
Allows mentors and the wolves they trained to be romantic after they become warriors
first cousin mates: Allow first cousins to be mates and have romantic interactions
Allows wolves with the same grandparents but different parents to become mates

by-status: The Pack will be fed according their status and within the status by age.
younger first: The Pack will be fed according to their age only.
less nutrition first: First the wolves with the lowest nutrition will be fed, afterwards the Pack will be fed according to their status.
hunter first: Firstly the wolves with a hunter skill will be fed, afterwards the Pack will be fed according to their status.
sick/injured first: Firstly the sick and injured wolves will be fed, afterwards the Pack will be fed according to their status.
more experience first: The Pack will be fed according their experience, highest one first.
ration prey: Healthy warriors will only eat half of the food they need, even if there is enough for the Pack.

business as usual: The Pack has no specific focus and won't get any bonuses.
hunting: The Pack will focus on hunting, each working warrior (including deputy and leader) and each working apprentice will gather additional prey on each moonskip.
herb gathering: The Pack will focus on herb gathering, each medicine cat and medicine cat apprentice will gather additional herbs on each moonskip due to extra help from the warriors.
threaten outsiders: The relationship with cats outside of the Pack decreases due to intentionally threatening behavior from your warriors.
seek outsiders: The relationship with cats outside of the Pack increases as your warriors make efforts to sow seeds of friendship.
rest and recover: The Pack will take more care and time in their tasks and therefore the rate of injuries, illnesses and outbreaks will be reduced.
sabotage other clans: Your mediator and warriors work together to undermine the other Packs. Only available if you have a working mediator. Selecting this will also allow you to choose which Packs you target.
aid other clans: Your mediator and warriors work together to help the other Packs with whatever they need. Only available if you have a working mediator. Selecting this will also allow you to choose which Packs you target.
raid other clans: Your warriors begin crossing borders for resources. Prey and herbs will greatly increase each moonskip, but injuries and illnesses will increase and the relationship with other Packs decrease. You will be able to choose which Packs you target.
hoarding: Your warriors begin stockpiling as many resources as they can get their paws on, regardless of their own safety. Prey and herbs will increase each moonskip, but injuries and illnesses will also increase.

these are special. they do not have a display name or a tooltip
